clinical_study.brief_title: PopPK Profile of Qishe Pill: Study Protocol for a Phase I Clinical Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Population Pharmacokinetic Modeling of Qishe Pill in Three Major TCM-defined Constitutional Types of Healthy Chinese Subjects: Study Protocol for a Phase I Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

clinical_study.source: Shanghai University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: Qishe Pill (Shanghai Sundise Traditional Chinese Medicine Co., Ltd, China), composed of processed Radix Astragali, Muscone, Szechuan Lovage Rhizome, Radix Stephaniae Tetrandrae, Ovientvine, and Calculus Bovis Artifactus, has been developed and spread in use into clinical settings in 2009. As individualization has become the trend of modern medicine, a personalized medicine of Qishe Pill should be documented and practiced with various patients according to the ancient TCM system, a classification of personalized constitution type, which has been established to determine predisposition and prognosis to diseases as well as therapy and life-style administration. Therefore, we describe the population pharmacokinetic profile of Qishe Pill and compare its extent of metabolism in the 3 major Constitution Type (Qi-Deficiency, Yin-Deficiency and Blood-Stasis) to address major challenges of individualized and standardized Traditional Chinese Medicine into clinical practice.

detailed_description.textblock: With the greatly increased morbidity of neck pain, it brought a large challenge to some optimal therapies for various situations in population at a given time based on their demographic, physiological and pathological characteristics. Chinese proprietary herbal medicines, as a kind of Complementary and Alternative Medicine (CAM), are usually developed from some well-established and long-standing recipes and formulated as tablets or capsules for commerce, convenience or palatability. Although these advantage mentioned, a good quantification and a strict standardization in detail are still need to be improved for individualized implementation in therapeutic strategies. Based on the YQHY decoction (Yi-Qi Hua-Yu Decoction, tonify Qi and promoting circulation and removing stasis), Qishe Pill (Shanghai Sundise Traditional Chinese Medicine Co., Ltd, China) has been developed and spread in use into clinical settings in 2009. As individualization has become the trend of modern medicine, a personalized medicine of Qishe Pill should be documented and practiced with various patients according to the ancient TCM system, a classification of personalized constitution type, which has been established to determine predisposition and prognosis to diseases as well as therapy and life-style administration. Therefore, we describe the population pharmacokinetic profile of Qishe Pill and compare its extent of metabolism in the 3 major Constitution Type (Qi-Deficiency, Yin-Deficiency and Blood-Stasis) to address major challenges of individualized and standardized Traditional Chinese Medicine into clinical practice.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of drug administration and blood sampling
primary_outcome.description: The investigators will assess all clinical AEs according to the Medical Dictionary for Regular Activities criteria, in terms of intensity (mild, moderate, or severe), duration, outcome and relationship to the study drug.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 2 of drug administration and blood sampling
primary_outcome.description: The investigators will assess all clinical AEs according to the Medical Dictionary for Regular Activities criteria, in terms of intensity (mild, moderate, or severe), duration, outcome and relationship to the study drug.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 3 of drug administration and blood sampling
primary_outcome.description: The investigators will assess all clinical AEs according to the Medical Dictionary for Regular Activities criteria, in terms of intensity (mild, moderate, or severe), duration, outcome and relationship to the study drug.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days after drug administration and blood sampling
primary_outcome.description: Subjects will be requested to return to the study unit 4 d after drug administration and blood sampling for a follow-up visit.

primary_outcome.measure: Peak Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Qishe Pill in low dosage
primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days after drug administration and blood sampling
primary_outcome.description: The maximum plasma concentration

primary_outcome.measure: Peak Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Qishe Pill in medial dosage
primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days after drug administration and blood sampling
primary_outcome.description: The maximum plasma concentration

primary_outcome.measure: Peak Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Qishe Pill in high dosage
primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days after drug administration and blood sampling
primary_outcome.description: The maximum plasma concentration

primary_outcome.measure: The Time to Peak Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Qishe Pill in low dosage
primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days after drug administration and blood sampling
primary_outcome.description: The time to maximum concentration

primary_outcome.measure: The Time to Peak Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Qishe Pill in medial dosage
primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days after drug administration and blood sampling
primary_outcome.description: The time to maximum concentration

primary_outcome.measure: The Time to Peak Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Qishe Pill in high dosage
primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days after drug administration and blood sampling
primary_outcome.description: The time to maximum concentration

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the Plasma Concentration versus Time Curve (AUC) of Qishe Pill in low dosage
primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days after drug administration and blood sampling
primary_outcome.description: The area under the plasma concentration-time curve (AUC) will be calculated using the linear trapezoidal rule.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the Plasma Concentration versus Time Curve (AUC) of Qishe Pill in medial dosage
primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days after drug administration and blood sampling
primary_outcome.description: The area under the plasma concentration-time curve (AUC) will be calculated using the linear trapezoidal rule.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the Plasma Concentration versus Time Curve (AUC) of Qishe Pill in high dosage
primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days after drug administration and blood sampling
primary_outcome.description: The area under the plasma concentration-time curve (AUC) will be calculated using the linear trapezoidal rule.

primary_outcome.measure: The distribution volume (DF) of Qishe Pill in low dosage
primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days after drug administration and blood sampling
primary_outcome.description: The distribution volume (DF) will be calculated by Dose/AUC/ke. ke is the elimination rate constant.

primary_outcome.measure: The distribution volume (DF) of Qishe Pill in medial dosage
primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days after drug administration and blood sampling
primary_outcome.description: The distribution volume (DF) will be calculated by Dose/AUC/ke. ke is the elimination rate constant.

primary_outcome.measure: The distribution volume (DF) of Qishe Pill in high dosage
primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days after drug administration and blood sampling
primary_outcome.description: The distribution volume (DF) will be calculated by Dose/AUC/ke. ke is the elimination rate constant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Deep phenotyping with genomics and functional genomics approaches
secondary_outcome.description: 3 ml blood samples for genomic variants analysis. The cytochrome P450 gene family, such as CYP1A1, CYP1A2, CYP2D6, CYP2C9, CYP2C19, CYP2E1, CYP3A4 and CYP3A5 , etc, will be chosen as the target objective.

secondary_outcome.measure: Deep phenotyping with genomics and functional genomics approaches
secondary_outcome.description: 3 ml blood samples for genomic variants analysis. The cytochrome P450 gene family, such as CYP1A1, CYP1A2, CYP2D6, CYP2C9, CYP2C19, CYP2E1, CYP3A4 and CYP3A5 , etc, will be chosen as the target objective.

other_outcome.measure: The Constitution in Chinese Medicine Questionnaire (CCMQ)
other_outcome.description: Two qualified traditional Chinese medical doctors licensed by the Chinese government determine the constitution according to CCMQ

other_outcome.measure: The Constitution in Chinese Medicine Questionnaire (CCMQ)
other_outcome.description: Two qualified traditional Chinese medical doctors licensed by the Chinese government determine the constitution according to CCMQ

These parameters including blood count, electrolytes, renal and liver function parameters, blood lipids, age, gender, history of smoking, blood pressure, weight (kg), and height (meters) will be obtained for all subjects.

arm_group.description: Qishe Pill（Shanghai Sundise Traditional Chinese Medicine Co., Ltd, China） in low dosage(3.75mg)
Qishe Pill（Shanghai Sundise Traditional Chinese Medicine Co., Ltd, China) in medial dosage(7.5mg)
Qishe Pill（Shanghai Sundise Traditional Chinese Medicine Co., Ltd, China）in high dosage(15mg)

intervention.description: Qishe Pill is a thin 0.15 g film-coated pill, composed of processed Radix Astragali, Muscone, Szechuan Lovage Rhizome, Radix Stephaniae Tetrandrae, Ovientvine, and Calculus Bovis Artifactus, which should be taken orally with water (240mL) after a minimum 10-hour fast

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion
- Aged 20-35
- 18.5 kg/m2 ≤Body mass index (BMI) <23 kg/m2
- TCM-constitutionally typed as either the 3 major type
Exclusion
- History of impaired fasting glucose or diabetes mellitus (past history of diabetes or fasting blood glucose at screening ≥100 mg/dl)
- History of liver disease (hepatitis, hepatic cirrhosis) or hepatic dysfunction (AST or ALT at screening ≥40 U/L)
- History of renal dysfunction (creatinine at screening ≥1.2 mg/dl)
- History of heart disease (heart failure, angina pectoris, myocardial infarction, arrhythmia)
- History of malignant tumor
- Having digestive disorders that can interfere with normal absorption of standard diet (gastritis, gastric ulcer, duodenitis, duodenal ulcer, etc.)
- Smoking during the recent 3 months
- Alcohol consumption 3 or more times a week during the recent 3 months
- Women who were pregnant, intended to become pregnant, or breast- feeding
- Medicated during the recent month for therapeutic or prophylactic purposes
- Participating in another clinical trial

facility.name: Longhua Hospital, Shanghai University of TCM
